From main_article_gyre_pp_supfig_v2.py
plot_sf3 = True
New production (NP), regenerated production (RP) and nitrification
(NIT) averaged on the subpolar box (35-45Â°N) between 0 and 100 meters
depth.
NP is FNO3PHY - nitrification
RP is FNH4PHY + nitrification
The hypothesis behind that is that primary production from locally
(between 0 and 100 meters) nitrified nitrate should be counted as
regenerated production. 

>>> CTL1
NP: 1.3466111266397576
NIT: 0.5100131193756322
>>> CC1
NP: 0.8918106395633273
NIT: 0.36833061870393474
>>> CTL1
RP: 1.7876929255167462
NIT: 0.5100131193756322
>>> CC1
RP: 1.4041061812939863
NIT: 0.36833061870393474
>>> CTL1_KL2000
NP: 1.4461352103167213
NIT: 0.5135472509867142
>>> CC1_KL2000
NP: 0.9771488028078896
NIT: 0.35707393634223217
>>> CTL1_KL2000

NIT: 0.5135472509867142

NIT: 0.35707393634223217
